crumble.translation[0].definitions[0].de: if something, especially something made of stone or rock, is crumbling, small pieces are breaking off it
crumble.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: The old stonework was crumbling away.
crumble.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to break apart into lots of little pieces, or make something do this
crumble.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: The fall leaves crumbled in my fingers.
crumble.translation[0].definitions[2].de: to lose power, become weak, or fail
crumble.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: The Empire began to crumble during the 13th century.
crumble.translation[1].definitions[0].de: a sweet dish of fruit covered with a dry mixture of flour, butter, and sugar and baked
